item.title: Writing a Paper
item.description: By George M. Whitesides 1. What is a Scientific Paper ? A paper is an organized description of hypotheses, date and conclusions, intended to instruct the reader. Papers are a central part of research . If you research does not generate papers, it might just as well not have been done. “Interesting and unpublished” is equivalent to “non-existent”. Realize that your objective in research is to formulate and test hypotheses, to draw conclusions from these tests, and to teach these conclusions to others.
